poem:
### Örebro Morning

A question, cold  
as the Swedish dawn—  
*why?*—  
echoes in frost-breath,  
settling over a nation  
heavy with silence.  
  
Eleven fallen leaves  
stir not in winter's grip,  
whisper their unfinished stories  
to the wind,  
asking for warmth  
in the quiet  
of a grieving sun.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Sweden reeling after deadliest mass shooting in history leaves 11 people dead – Europe live 7.57am GMT Morning opening: Why? Örebro and Sweden wake up this morning desperate to know the answer to a straightforward question: why? The country wakes up this morning reeling from the deadliest mass shooting in its history, with eleven people dead after an attack at an adult education centre on Tuesday. The death toll could still change. Region Örebro confirmed". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Sweden reeling after deadliest mass shooting in history leaves 11 people dead – Europe live 7.57am GMT Morning opening: Why? Örebro and Sweden wake up this morning desperate to know the answer to a straightforward question: why? The country wakes up this morning reeling from the deadliest mass shooting in its history, with eleven people dead after an attack at an adult education centre on Tuesday. The death toll could still change. Region Örebro confirmed
